intro: Sciadopanax aubrevillei, commonly known as the African arrowhead plant, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound, arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbels, and it produces berries that are red when mature. Sciadopanax aubrevillei is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
